item.title: Earl K. Miller
PsychoPy
item.description: Happy new year to all of our users and community!🌟 🌟 🌟 🌟 🌟 🌟 🌟 A big thank you to everyone who has used our tools and contributed to their development over the last year. Bring on 2024!!🌟 🌟 🌟 🌟 🌟 🌟 🌟

item.title: António Domingues
item.description:
PSA #scihub has a new home:Anna’s Archive
https://annas-archive.org/Please avoid at all costs if you don't want access to scientific literature. It might be illegal and whatnot.#academia #scienceUpdate: turns out that this might not be associated with sci-hub as I thought and implied, but rather a mirror and extension of it:https://annas-archive.org/datasets/scihubProceed with care and apologies for any confusion.It's also typical of me. First viral toot and it's sort of incorrect.

item.title: PsychoPy
item.description: Why not start the new year with some PsychoPy videos?😎In case you missed it, we've released a couple of videos on how to use Pavlovia Surveys just before Christmas and it's now compiled into this playlist 👉🏻https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLJVOIgS89ZnP5ajKzFyNaALehRTF2eDOv

item.title: Andrew Dessler
item.description: Calls/emails from reporters asking for a comment on last's years temperature are coming earlier than normal this year. Time to dust off my "last year was hot" auto-response.

item.title: European Commission
item.description:
One year has gone by and kunas have become euros! 🇭🇷💶In 2023, Croatia became the 20th country to introduce the euro, a symbol of our European unity and sovereignty.It was a great day for the people of Croatia and Europeans across the euro area.
This year, we mark another significant anniversary – 25 years of the euro.Let's grow stronger together!#EUROinCroatia

item.title: Matteo Farinella
item.description: "We have taken on the biggest question facing humanity — how the brain works — and we need as many brains as possible to answer it. If we keep writing inscrutable papers, we silo knowledge away from those who can help." Words of wisdom from my friend @KanakaRajanPhD - she's using comics to demystify computational neuroscience 👏https://hms.harvard.edu/news/building-models-brain-take-them-apart#scicomm #neuroscience #accessibility

item.title: PsychoPy
item.description: Did you know you can run QUEST staircases out of box in online experiments? Try the demo and view template psychopy files to get started here 👉 https://pavlovia.org/demos/staircase_quest Enabled via jsQuest https://github.com/kurokida/jsQUEST

item.title: Florian Aigner
item.description:
Nein, die Behörden haben über Wirksamkeit und Sicherheit der COVID-Impfung nicht gelogen. Leute, die das behaupten, können bloß keine Studien richtig lesen.
Ein wunderbar unaufgeregter, faktenreicher Artikel zum Lesen und Teilen:
https://www.profil.at/faktiv/corona-impfung-wurde-die-oeffentlichkeit-wirklich-belogen/402717466

item.title: Karen Sandler
item.description: Big news on the Vizio case - the court rejected Vizio's arguments in their summary judgment motion. The decision cuts to the core of the case, with clear and conclusive language. Now on to *our* motion for summary adjudication...https://sfconservancy.org/news/2024/jan/03/vizio-sj-rejected/

item.title: Earl K. Miller
item.description:
I am very saddened to learn of the passing of Peter Schiller. Peter was a great scientist. He took me under his wing when I started at MIT. I'll never forget him. Miss you, Peter.
#neuroscience

item.title: tomstafford
item.description: FRESH WORDSFrom me, on BBC FutureIt's about how a teenage achieved the impossible in an arcade game nearly three times older than him, about how communities support learning, and about why I'm optimistic about human flourishing in the digital agehttps://www.bbc.co.uk/future/article/20240103-tetris-how-a-us-teenager-achieved-the-impossible#learning #tetris #AI #CognitiveScience

item.title: Ulrike Franke
item.description: “This perception of stalemate, however, is deeply flawed. Both Moscow and Kyiv are in a race to rebuild offensive combat power….the materiel, personnel training, and casualties that each side accrues in the next few months will determine the long-term trajectory of the conflict.”The War in Ukraine Is Not a Stalemate | Foreign Affairshttps://www.foreignaffairs.com/ukraine/war-ukraine-not-stalemate

item.title: Earl K. Miller
item.description: When I first started at MIT, Peter shared everything with me, copies of his grants, lab budget, much advice, etc. I used to have regular dinners with Peter. I learned to always let Peter choose the wine. If not, he would complain about the wine. :)
